location: Alexandria. A room in CLEOPATRAs palace.

lines.text: Enter DEMETRIUS and PHILO

lines.speaker: philo
lines.text: Nay, but this dotage of our generals Oerflows the measure: those his goodly eyes, That oer the files and musters of the war Have glowd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn, The office and devotion of their view Upon a tawny front: his captains heart, Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper, And is become the bellows and the fan To cool a gipsys lust. Look, where they come: Take but good note, and you shall see in him. The triple pillar of the world transformd Into a strumpets fool: behold and see.
Flourish. Enter ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, her Ladies, the Train, with Eunuchs fanning her

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: If it be love indeed, tell me how much.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Theres beggary in the love that can be reckond.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Ill set a bourn how far to be beloved.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.
Enter an Attendant

lines.speaker: attendant
lines.text: News, my good lord, from Rome.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Grates me: the sum.

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Nay, hear them, Antony: Fulvia perchance is angry or, who knows If the scarcebearded Caesar have not sent His powerful mandate to you, Do this, or this Take in that kingdom, and enfranchise that Perform t, or else we damn thee.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: How, my love!

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Perchance! nay, and most like: You must not stay here longer, your dismission Is come from Caesar therefore hear it, Antony. Wheres Fulvias process Caesars I would say both Call in the messengers. As I am Egypts queen, Thou blushest, Antony and that blood of thine Is Caesars homager: else so thy cheek pays shame When shrilltongued Fulvia scolds. The messengers!

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch Of the ranged empire fall! Here is my space. Kingdoms are clay: our dungy earth alike Feeds beast as man: the nobleness of life Is to do thus when such a mutual pair And such a twain can dot, in which I bind, On pain of punishment, the world to weet We stand up peerless.
Embracing

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Excellent falsehood! Why did he marry Fulvia, and not love her Ill seem the fool I am not Antony Will be himself.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: But stirrd by Cleopatra. Now, for the love of Love and her soft hours, Lets not confound the time with conference harsh: Theres not a minute of our lives should stretch Without some pleasure now. What sport tonight

lines.speaker: cleopatra
lines.text: Hear the ambassadors.

lines.speaker: mark antony
lines.text: Fie, wrangling queen! Whom every thing becomes, to chide, to laugh, To weep whose every passion fully strives To make itself, in thee, fair and admired! No messenger, but thine and all alone Tonight well wander through the streets and note The qualities of people. Come, my queen Last night you did desire it: speak not to us.
Exeunt MARK ANTONY and CLEOPATRA with their train

lines.speaker: demetrius
lines.text: Is Caesar with Antonius prized so slight

lines.speaker: philo
lines.text: Sir, sometimes, when he is not Antony, He comes too short of that great property Which still should go with Antony.

lines.speaker: demetrius
lines.text: I am full sorry That he approves the common liar, who Thus speaks of him at Rome: but I will hope Of better deeds tomorrow. Rest you happy!
Exeunt
